title: You cannot consistently be a Christian and support homosexuality or gay marriage.

author: Mogsitis
text:
As a Christian, please don't speak for Christians. You are awful and my pastor(s) and I have many times spoken out for the LGBT congregants at our church.

A literal Master of Theology has spoken to me more about the Bible and it's contextual passages, the false justifications of some so-called Christians' bigotry, etc.

Just fucking love people, and if you can't, shut your mouth.

author: hydrolock12
text: So how does this "Master of Theology" explain away explicit passages against it?

author: Ludoamorous_Slut
text: Why the scare quotes? Do you do that for other degrees as well?

author: hydrolock12
text: Well yeah, I would it it for any situation where I am quoting the thing in question...

author: Ludoamorous_Slut
text:
I guess what seems odd is quoting it rather than just referring to it, since usually when that is done it's a rhetorical device to undermine someone. Like, if someone says

> The latest proposal was signed by Senator John Johnson.

And I respond with

> Oh? And what did the proposal by "Senator" John Johnson say?

it would be safe to assume that I don't consider his senatorship legitimate.

author: Mogsitis
text: Let me ask him. :) In the meantime, since you don't "support" homosexuality, what is your stance towards homosexual people, and how would you have us treat them, or "treat" them even?

author: hydrolock12
text: With love and kindness...?

author: Mogsitis
text: So what is the point of your post? And how do you think homosexual people in your life might react if you say "I love you and accept you, but I don't support you when you want to show love to your partner."?

author: hydrolock12
text:
>So what is the point of your post?

What part of the post is unclear?

How they react is not up to me. I can't control their reaction.

author: Mogsitis
text: What is your point, if you could clarify? You want to treat people with love and kindness but not support them, and tell others that they are not True Christians if they do so, even if their aim is just to treat people with love and kindness as well.

text: I’m well aware. And there are more gospels that are not in the NT. And I’m still waiting. If you’d like to chip in anything from anywhere in the NT or gnostic gospels, please feel free to do so.

author: hydrolock12
text: For what sorry?

author: 1biggeek
text: Oh waiting for a response from the poster that said that it was abundantly clear that The Christian g-d is totally anti-homosexual and that homosexuals should die a bloody death.  So I’m asking for a reference as to where Jesus ever spoke about homosexuality.

author: hydrolock12
text:
Wait, you are going all over the place here.

The OP never said anything about them dying.

You also first asked for something in the NT, then restricted that specifically to Jesus.

Then you change it from them dying to simply being spoken about.

First of all, which do you want, something from Jesus or from the NT?
